Tesla isnâ€™t just slowing downâ€”its rivals are speeding up.Industry experts point to two main reasons:Teslaâ€™s product lineup is aging, with limited updates to Models S, X, 3, and Y.Elon Muskâ€™s political and social media activity may be turning off some buyers.While Model Y and Model 3 remain best-sellers, declining market share could impact resale values and Teslaâ€™s overall brand power.ğŸ’¥ 2. Tesla Accelerates Its Expansion Into IndiaWhile Tesla faces challenges in California and with supply chains, itâ€™s also entering a massive new marketâ€”India.The company has posted over 25 job openings in India, many related to charging infrastructure, battery materials, and supply chain operationsâ€”not just retail or sales.One job listing specifically mentioned expertise in LFP and NMC battery materials, hinting that Tesla may be planning to source or produce batteries locally.Adding to the excitement, the Model Y was spotted test-driving in Mumbai, suggesting real-world trials are already underway.With over 1.4 billion people and a fast-growing demand for EVs, India has the potential to become Teslaâ€™s next big growth engineâ€”alongside the U.S. and China.

Tesla isnâ€™t just slowing downâ€”its rivals are speeding up.Industry experts point to two main reasons:Teslaâ€™s product lineup is aging, with limited updates to Models S, X, 3, and Y.Elon Muskâ€™s political and social media activity may be turning off some buyers.While Model Y and Model 3 remain best-sellers, declining market share could impact resale values and Teslaâ€™s overall brand power.ğŸ’¥ 2. Cybercab and Semi Face Delays Due to TariffsAnother red flag: new tariffs may disrupt Teslaâ€™s ambitious plans for next-gen vehicles like the Cybercab and the Semi truck.Reports indicate that tariffs on Chinese-made parts could rise as high as 145% under new trade policies. Tesla Accelerates Its Expansion Into IndiaWhile Tesla faces challenges in California and with supply chains, itâ€™s also entering a massive new marketâ€”India.The company has posted over 25 job openings in India, many related to charging infrastructure, battery materials, and supply chain operationsâ€”not just retail or sales.One job listing specifically mentioned expertise in LFP and NMC battery materials, hinting that Tesla may be planning to source or produce batteries locally.Adding to the excitement, the Model Y was spotted test-driving in Mumbai, suggesting real-world trials are already underway.With over 1.4 billion people and a fast-growing demand for EVs, India has the potential to become Teslaâ€™s next big growth engineâ€”alongside the U.S. and China.

In Q1 2025, Teslaâ€™s share of the EV market in California dropped to 43.9%, down from 55.5% a year earlier. Thatâ€™s a 12-point decline in just one year.While Teslaâ€™s registrations fell by 15%, other EV makers saw a 35% surge. The takeaway? Tesla isnâ€™t just slowing downâ€”its rivals are speeding up.Industry experts point to two main reasons:Teslaâ€™s product lineup is aging, with limited updates to Models S, X, 3, and Y.Elon Muskâ€™s political and social media activity may be turning off some buyers.While Model Y and Model 3 remain best-sellers, declining market share could impact resale values and Teslaâ€™s overall brand power.ğŸ’¥ 2. Cybercab and Semi Face Delays Due to TariffsAnother red flag: new tariffs may disrupt Teslaâ€™s ambitious plans for next-gen vehicles like the Cybercab and the Semi truck.Reports indicate that tariffs on Chinese-made parts could rise as high as 145% under new trade policies. In response, Tesla has reportedly halted parts imports from Chinaâ€”potentially delaying the October 2025 prototype production and pushing back mass production to 2026.Tesla had previously absorbed tariffs up to 34%, but beyond that, costs become unsustainable.However, despite these hurdles, Tesla isnâ€™t slowing down. The company is actively hiring for its Robotaxi division, including roles like Diagnostics Engineer, Robotaxi Operationsâ€”a clear sign itâ€™s still investing in autonomous driving as a long-term growth engine.ğŸŒ 3. Tesla Accelerates Its Expansion Into IndiaWhile Tesla faces challenges in California and with supply chains, itâ€™s also entering a massive new marketâ€”India.The company has posted over 25 job openings in India, many related to charging infrastructure, battery materials, and supply chain operationsâ€”not just retail or sales.One job listing specifically mentioned expertise in LFP and NMC battery materials, hinting that Tesla may be planning to source or produce batteries locally.Adding to the excitement, the Model Y was spotted test-driving in Mumbai, suggesting real-world trials are already underway.With over 1.4 billion people and a fast-growing demand for EVs, India has the potential to become Teslaâ€™s next big growth engineâ€”alongside the U.S. and China.

Teslaâ€™s Market Share in California Is Dropping FastCalifornia has long been Teslaâ€™s strongholdâ€”but recent data reveals a worrying trend. In Q1 2025, Teslaâ€™s share of the EV market in California dropped to 43.9%, down from 55.5% a year earlier. Thatâ€™s a 12-point decline in just one year.While Teslaâ€™s registrations fell by 15%, other EV makers saw a 35% surge. The takeaway? Tesla isnâ€™t just slowing downâ€”its rivals are speeding up.Industry experts point to two main reasons:Teslaâ€™s product lineup is aging, with limited updates to Models S, X, 3, and Y.Elon Muskâ€™s political and social media activity may be turning off some buyers.While Model Y and Model 3 remain best-sellers, declining market share could impact resale values and Teslaâ€™s overall brand power.ğŸ’¥ 2. Cybercab and Semi Face Delays Due to TariffsAnother red flag: new tariffs may disrupt Teslaâ€™s ambitious plans for next-gen vehicles like the Cybercab and the Semi truck.Reports indicate that tariffs on Chinese-made parts could rise as high as 145% under new trade policies. In response, Tesla has reportedly halted parts imports from Chinaâ€”potentially delaying the October 2025 prototype production and pushing back mass production to 2026.Tesla had previously absorbed tariffs up to 34%, but beyond that, costs become unsustainable.However, despite these hurdles, Tesla isnâ€™t slowing down. The company is actively hiring for its Robotaxi division, including roles like Diagnostics Engineer, Robotaxi Operationsâ€”a clear sign itâ€™s still investing in autonomous driving as a long-term growth engine.ğŸŒ 3. Tesla Accelerates Its Expansion Into IndiaWhile Tesla faces challenges in California and with supply chains, itâ€™s also entering a massive new marketâ€”India.The company has posted over 25 job openings in India, many related to charging infrastructure, battery materials, and supply chain operationsâ€”not just retail or sales.One job listing specifically mentioned expertise in LFP and NMC battery materials, hinting that Tesla may be planning to source or produce batteries locally.Adding to the excitement, the Model Y was spotted test-driving in Mumbai, suggesting real-world trials are already underway.With over 1.4 billion people and a fast-growing demand for EVs, India has the potential to become Teslaâ€™s next big growth engineâ€”alongside the U.S. and China.

The ideal candidate will be proficient in programming languages such as Python, Java, or SQL for data manipulation and analysis. The candidate should have knowledge of Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) processes and tools like Apache NiFi, Talend, or Informatica. Experience with data warehousing solutions such as Amazon Redshift, or Snowflake is required. Proficiency in scripting languages (e.g., Bash, PowerShell) for automation of data processes is a must. The role will involve working in the Risk and Anti Money laundering (AML) space, so any relevant experience would be advantageous.  Job Description 3: Data QA Engineer As a Data QA Engineer is needed to join our team. The ideal candidate will have skills in writing and executing test cases for both production and non-production environments. Familiarity with automated testing frameworks and tools like Selenium, JUnit is required. An understanding of AWS cloud and AWS cloud native services is a plus. The candidate will also be involved in risk management and anti-money laundering projects, so experience in these areas, particularly in the banking sector, is beneficial.  Job Description 4: Cloud Computing Specialist We are seeking a Cloud Computing Specialist with an understanding of AWS cloud and AWS cloud native services. The candidate should have proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or SQL and experience with scripting languages (e.g., Bash, PowerShell). Familiarity with database management systems and data warehousing solutions such as Amazon Redshift, or Snowflake is important. The role involves working in the Risk and Anti Money laundering (AML) space, so any experience in these areas would be a plus.

Teslaâ€™s Market Share in California Is Dropping FastCalifornia has long been Teslaâ€™s strongholdâ€”but recent data reveals a worrying trend. In Q1 2025, Teslaâ€™s share of the EV market in California dropped to 43.9%, down from 55.5% a year earlier. Thatâ€™s a 12-point decline in just one year.While Teslaâ€™s registrations fell by 15%, other EV makers saw a 35% surge. The takeaway? Tesla isnâ€™t just slowing downâ€”its rivals are speeding up.Industry experts point to two main reasons:Teslaâ€™s product lineup is aging, with limited updates to Models S, X, 3, and Y.Elon Muskâ€™s political and social media activity may be turning off some buyers.While Model Y and Model 3 remain best-sellers, declining market share could impact resale values and Teslaâ€™s overall brand power.ğŸ’¥ 2. Cybercab and Semi Face Delays Due to TariffsAnother red flag: new tariffs may disrupt Teslaâ€™s ambitious plans for next-gen vehicles like the Cybercab and the Semi truck.Reports indicate that tariffs on Chinese-made parts could rise as high as 145% under new trade policies. The company is actively hiring for its Robotaxi division, including roles like Diagnostics Engineer, Robotaxi Operationsâ€”a clear sign itâ€™s still investing in autonomous driving as a long-term growth engine.ğŸŒ 3. Tesla Accelerates Its Expansion Into IndiaWhile Tesla faces challenges in California and with supply chains, itâ€™s also entering a massive new marketâ€”India.The company has posted over 25 job openings in India, many related to charging infrastructure, battery materials, and supply chain operationsâ€”not just retail or sales.One job listing specifically mentioned expertise in LFP and NMC battery materials, hinting that Tesla may be planning to source or produce batteries locally.Adding to the excitement, the Model Y was spotted test-driving in Mumbai, suggesting real-world trials are already underway.With over 1.4 billion people and a fast-growing demand for EVs, India has the potential to become Teslaâ€™s next big growth engineâ€”alongside the U.S. and China.

Experience with data warehousing solutions such as Amazon Redshift, or Snowflake is required. Proficiency in scripting languages (e.g., Bash, PowerShell) for automation of data processes is a must. The role will involve working in the Risk and Anti Money laundering (AML) space, so any relevant experience would be advantageous.  Job Description 3: Data QA Engineer As a Data QA Engineer is needed to join our team. The ideal candidate will have skills in writing and executing test cases for both production and non-production environments. Familiarity with automated testing frameworks and tools like Selenium, JUnit is required. An understanding of AWS cloud and AWS cloud native services is a plus. The candidate will also be involved in risk management and anti-money laundering projects, so experience in these areas, particularly in the banking sector, is beneficial.  Job Description 4: Cloud Computing Specialist We are seeking a Cloud Computing Specialist with an understanding of AWS cloud and AWS cloud native services. The candidate should have proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or SQL and experience with scripting languages (e.g., Bash, PowerShell). Familiarity with database management systems and data warehousing solutions such as Amazon Redshift, or Snowflake is important. The role involves working in the Risk and Anti Money laundering (AML) space, so any experience in these areas would be a plus.

Not another social media series! ğŸ˜©Hereâ€™s mine:A cover letter a day! Join me while I write cover letters to companies Iâ€™m applying to. My goal is to fill the cover letters with personality and make it less of a drag.Hereâ€™s my first one in the series:Dear Hiring Team,I'm a software engineer who builds full-stack applications that center people â€” their stories, their connections, their needs. When I came across TailorCareâ€™s mission to make specialty care more personal and more effective, it resonated deeply with how I think about good technology: it should guide, empower, and remove friction from peopleâ€™s lives.Most recently, I built Foodship, an application that helps people foster new friendships over shared meals. Users set up a profile, share their food preferences, pick a time, and get matched with others and a compatible restaurant. To support meaningful interactions, I use a chat completion model with a psychotherapist-inspired prompt to generate curated conversation questions designed to spark trust and reflection. I designed and built this app â€” front to back â€” using EJS, CSS/SCSS, Bootstrap, JavaScript, Node.js, Express.js, Passport.js, Socket.io, Agenda.js, Hugging Face API, and MongoDB.What draws me to TailorCare is the chance to collaborate across disciplines to build systems that are technically sound, human-centered, and impactful. Your work sits at the intersection of data, healthcare, and empathy â€” and thatâ€™s where I want to be. I bring a fast-learning mindset, clean code, and strong collaboration skills. Iâ€™m also no stranger to debugging odd issues at 2 a.m. or chasing down a race condition like it owes me money.Thanks for taking the time to read this. Iâ€™d love to connect and learn more about what youâ€™re building at TailorCare.Warmly,Roosiel Agramonte

To support meaningful interactions, I use a chat completion model with a psychotherapist-inspired prompt to generate curated conversation questions designed to spark trust and reflection. I designed and built this app â€” front to back â€” using EJS, CSS/SCSS, Bootstrap, JavaScript, Node.js, Express.js, Passport.js, Socket.io, Agenda.js, Hugging Face API, and MongoDB.What draws me to TailorCare is the chance to collaborate across disciplines to build systems that are technically sound, human-centered, and impactful. Not another social media series! ğŸ˜©Hereâ€™s mine:A cover letter a day! Join me while I write cover letters to companies Iâ€™m applying to. My goal is to fill the cover letters with personality and make it less of a drag.Hereâ€™s my first one in the series:Dear Hiring Team,I'm a software engineer who builds full-stack applications that center people â€” their stories, their connections, their needs. When I came across TailorCareâ€™s mission to make specialty care more personal and more effective, it resonated deeply with how I think about good technology: it should guide, empower, and remove friction from peopleâ€™s lives.Most recently, I built Foodship, an application that helps people foster new friendships over shared meals. Users set up a profile, share their food preferences, pick a time, and get matched with others and a compatible restaurant. To support meaningful interactions, I use a chat completion model with a psychotherapist-inspired prompt to generate curated conversation questions designed to spark trust and reflection. I designed and built this app â€” front to back â€” using EJS, CSS/SCSS, Bootstrap, JavaScript, Node.js, Express.js, Passport.js, Socket.io, Agenda.js, Hugging Face API, and MongoDB.What draws me to TailorCare is the chance to collaborate across disciplines to build systems that are technically sound, human-centered, and impactful. Your work sits at the intersection of data, healthcare, and empathy â€” and thatâ€™s where I want to be. I bring a fast-learning mindset, clean code, and strong collaboration skills. Iâ€™m also no stranger to debugging odd issues at 2 a.m. or chasing down a race condition like it owes me money.Thanks for taking the time to read this. Iâ€™d love to connect and learn more about what youâ€™re building at TailorCare.Warmly,Roosiel Agramonte

To support meaningful interactions, I use a chat completion model with a psychotherapist-inspired prompt to generate curated conversation questions designed to spark trust and reflection. I designed and built this app â€” front to back â€” using EJS, CSS/SCSS, Bootstrap, JavaScript, Node.js, Express.js, Passport.js, Socket.io, Agenda.js, Hugging Face API, and MongoDB.What draws me to TailorCare is the chance to collaborate across disciplines to build systems that are technically sound, human-centered, and impactful. To support meaningful interactions, I use a chat completion model with a psychotherapist-inspired prompt to generate curated conversation questions designed to spark trust and reflection. I designed and built this app â€” front to back â€” using EJS, CSS/SCSS, Bootstrap, JavaScript, Node.js, Express.js, Passport.js, Socket.io, Agenda.js, Hugging Face API, and MongoDB.What draws me to TailorCare is the chance to collaborate across disciplines to build systems that are technically sound, human-centered, and impactful. Your work sits at the intersection of data, healthcare, and empathy â€” and thatâ€™s where I want to be. I bring a fast-learning mindset, clean code, and strong collaboration skills. Iâ€™m also no stranger to debugging odd issues at 2 a.m. or chasing down a race condition like it owes me money.Thanks for taking the time to read this. Tesla isnâ€™t just slowing downâ€”its rivals are speeding up.Industry experts point to two main reasons:Teslaâ€™s product lineup is aging, with limited updates to Models S, X, 3, and Y.Elon Muskâ€™s political and social media activity may be turning off some buyers.While Model Y and Model 3 remain best-sellers, declining market share could impact resale values and Teslaâ€™s overall brand power.ğŸ’¥ 2. When I came across TailorCareâ€™s mission to make specialty care more personal and more effective, it resonated deeply with how I think about good technology: it should guide, empower, and remove friction from peopleâ€™s lives.Most recently, I built Foodship, an application that helps people foster new friendships over shared meals. Users set up a profile, share their food preferences, pick a time, and get matched with others and a compatible restaurant. To support meaningful interactions, I use a chat completion model with a psychotherapist-inspired prompt to generate curated conversation questions designed to spark trust and reflection. I designed and built this app â€” front to back â€” using EJS, CSS/SCSS, Bootstrap, JavaScript, Node.js, Express.js, Passport.js, Socket.io, Agenda.js, Hugging Face API, and MongoDB.What draws me to TailorCare is the chance to collaborate across disciplines to build systems that are technically sound, human-centered, and impactful. Your work sits at the intersection of data, healthcare, and empathy â€” and thatâ€™s where I want to be. I bring a fast-learning mindset, clean code, and strong collaboration skills. Iâ€™m also no stranger to debugging odd issues at 2 a.m. or chasing down a race condition like it owes me money.Thanks for taking the time to read this. Not another social media series! ğŸ˜©Hereâ€™s mine:A cover letter a day! Join me while I write cover letters to companies Iâ€™m applying to. My goal is to fill the cover letters with personality and make it less of a drag.Hereâ€™s my first one in the series:Dear Hiring Team,I'm a software engineer who builds full-stack applications that center people â€” their stories, their connections, their needs. When I came across TailorCareâ€™s mission to make specialty care more personal and more effective, it resonated deeply with how I think about good technology: it should guide, empower, and remove friction from peopleâ€™s lives.Most recently, I built Foodship, an application that helps people foster new friendships over shared meals. Users set up a profile, share their food preferences, pick a time, and get matched with others and a compatible restaurant. To support meaningful interactions, I use a chat completion model with a psychotherapist-inspired prompt to generate curated conversation questions designed to spark trust and reflection. I designed and built this app â€” front to back â€” using EJS, CSS/SCSS, Bootstrap, JavaScript, Node.js, Express.js, Passport.js, Socket.io, Agenda.js, Hugging Face API, and MongoDB.What draws me to TailorCare is the chance to collaborate across disciplines to build systems that are technically sound, human-centered, and impactful. Your work sits at the intersection of data, healthcare, and empathy â€” and thatâ€™s where I want to be. I bring a fast-learning mindset, clean code, and strong collaboration skills. Iâ€™m also no stranger to debugging odd issues at 2 a.m. or chasing down a race condition like it owes me money.Thanks for taking the time to read this. Iâ€™d love to connect and learn more about what youâ€™re building at TailorCare.Warmly,Roosiel Agramonte

To support meaningful interactions, I use a chat completion model with a psychotherapist-inspired prompt to generate curated conversation questions designed to spark trust and reflection. I designed and built this app â€” front to back â€” using EJS, CSS/SCSS, Bootstrap, JavaScript, Node.js, Express.js, Passport.js, Socket.io, Agenda.js, Hugging Face API, and MongoDB.What draws me to TailorCare is the chance to collaborate across disciplines to build systems that are technically sound, human-centered, and impactful. To support meaningful interactions, I use a chat completion model with a psychotherapist-inspired prompt to generate curated conversation questions designed to spark trust and reflection. I designed and built this app â€” front to back â€” using EJS, CSS/SCSS, Bootstrap, JavaScript, Node.js, Express.js, Passport.js, Socket.io, Agenda.js, Hugging Face API, and MongoDB.What draws me to TailorCare is the chance to collaborate across disciplines to build systems that are technically sound, human-centered, and impactful. Tesla isnâ€™t just slowing downâ€”its rivals are speeding up.Industry experts point to two main reasons:Teslaâ€™s product lineup is aging, with limited updates to Models S, X, 3, and Y.Elon Muskâ€™s political and social media activity may be turning off some buyers.While Model Y and Model 3 remain best-sellers, declining market share could impact resale values and Teslaâ€™s overall brand power.ğŸ’¥ 2. The ideal candidate will be proficient in programming languages such as Python, Java, or SQL for data manipulation and analysis. Experience with relational database management systems (RDBMS) such as MySQL, Oracle, or PostgreSQL is a must, as well as familiarity with NoSQL databases like MongoDB or Cassandra. The candidate should be skilled in using data analysis tools and platforms, such as Excel, R, or MATLAB and be adept at using data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or D3.js. Experience in the Risk systems for Banks would be a plus.  Job Description 2: Data Integration Specialist We are looking for a Data Integration Specialist to join our team. The candidate should have knowledge of Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) processes and tools like Apache NiFi, Talend, or Informatica. Experience with data warehousing solutions such as Amazon Redshift, or Snowflake is required. Proficiency in scripting languages (e.g., Bash, PowerShell) for automation of data processes is a must. The role will involve working in the Risk and Anti Money laundering (AML) space, so any relevant experience would be advantageous.  Job Description 3: Data QA Engineer As a Data QA Engineer is needed to join our team. The ideal candidate will have skills in writing and executing test cases for both production and non-production environments. Familiarity with automated testing frameworks and tools like Selenium, JUnit is required. An understanding of AWS cloud and AWS cloud native services is a plus. The candidate will also be involved in risk management and anti-money laundering projects, so experience in these areas, particularly in the banking sector, is beneficial.  Job Description 4: Cloud Computing Specialist We are seeking a Cloud Computing Specialist with an understanding of AWS cloud and AWS cloud native services. The candidate should have proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or SQL and experience with scripting languages (e.g., Bash, PowerShell). Familiarity with database management systems and data warehousing solutions such as Amazon Redshift, or Snowflake is important. The role involves working in the Risk and Anti Money laundering (AML) space, so any experience in these areas would be a plus.

Not another social media series! ğŸ˜©Hereâ€™s mine:A cover letter a day! Join me while I write cover letters to companies Iâ€™m applying to. My goal is to fill the cover letters with personality and make it less of a drag.Hereâ€™s my first one in the series:Dear Hiring Team,I'm a software engineer who builds full-stack applications that center people â€” their stories, their connections, their needs. When I came across TailorCareâ€™s mission to make specialty care more personal and more effective, it resonated deeply with how I think about good technology: it should guide, empower, and remove friction from peopleâ€™s lives.Most recently, I built Foodship, an application that helps people foster new friendships over shared meals. Users set up a profile, share their food preferences, pick a time, and get matched with others and a compatible restaurant. To support meaningful interactions, I use a chat completion model with a psychotherapist-inspired prompt to generate curated conversation questions designed to spark trust and reflection. I designed and built this app â€” front to back â€” using EJS, CSS/SCSS, Bootstrap, JavaScript, Node.js, Express.js, Passport.js, Socket.io, Agenda.js, Hugging Face API, and MongoDB.What draws me to TailorCare is the chance to collaborate across disciplines to build systems that are technically sound, human-centered, and impactful. Your work sits at the intersection of data, healthcare, and empathy â€” and thatâ€™s where I want to be. I bring a fast-learning mindset, clean code, and strong collaboration skills. Iâ€™m also no stranger to debugging odd issues at 2 a.m. or chasing down a race condition like it owes me money.Thanks for taking the time to read this. Iâ€™d love to connect and learn more about what youâ€™re building at TailorCare.Warmly,Roosiel Agramonte
